title: Frontend Developer Angular till IT Horse Core
Java and Frontend developers to New Cash Ledger project at SEB
description:
Are you attracted by the opportunity to shoulder a key role and contribute to one of SEB's most unique modernization projects ever? Great! We are now looking for Java and Frontend developers to New Cash Ledger (NCL) project.
   

  

 A very important task in the NCL project is to build a new Cash pool solution from scratch and that is what this team is doing. The work started 6 months ago, and the team consists of 9 very qualified team players in roles of developers, tech leads, architects, project manager and requirements specialists. The team works in a true agile way delivering continuously.
   

  

 The New Cash Ledger project is a major top prioritized initiative that affects large parts of the Bank
   

  

**About The Role**
 In the role as Java or Frontend developer at SEB and Core Ledger, you are offered the opportunity to thrive as a software engineer being in a modern organization with a high rate of change. You will be part of and contribute to a unique top prioritized journey of change where you and your team are responsible for building a completely new Nordic Cash pool solution.
   

  

 We work in a pragmatic, iterative process focused on the delivery of working software. We lean on modern concepts of continuous integration, testing and deployment to enable rapid development and a fail-fast mindset without compromising quality.
   

  

**Java Backend** 
 :
   

  

 As part of this role, you’ll work on building Java services based on the Ports and Adapters architectural pattern. The technology stack includes:
   

  

**Tech Stack:** 
 Java 21, Quarkus, Server-Side Templating (Qute, HTML, CSS, JavaScript), SQL (Not JPA/ORM), Open Telemetry, Maven.
   

  

**Software** 
**Deployment:** 
 Docker, Sonarqube, Prometheus, Grafana, GCP (Artifactory, Compute, Cloud Run, CloudSQL/Postgres, PubSub).
   

  

**Frontend** 
 :
   

  

 For the Frontend role, your focus will be on developing dynamic web applications using modern frameworks and tools.
   

  

**Responsibilities & Requirements:**
 Develop dynamic web applications using JavaScript/TypeScript and ReactJS, leveraging microfrontend architectures for modularity. Ensure code robustness with unit, component, and E2E automation tests. Collaborate across teams to deliver seamless user experiences, conduct code reviews, and adopt modern trends and tools (e.g., Webpack, Babel, Jest, Cypress, ESLint, Prettier, VSCode). Strong communication, API integration, and agile development skills are essential. Familiarity with microfrontend architectures is a plus.
   

  

 To thrive in this role, we believe you have
   

  

* Experience in some or all the above-mentioned technologies.
* At least 5 years as a professional developer.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and a drive to find the best solutions.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively in a team environment.


**What We Offer**
* A key strategic role in one of SEB: s most interesting IT/Tech area.
* Friendly and welcoming culture
* Access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits
* Innovative company in forefront of technology
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Innovative working environment with highly motivated colleagues.
* Balance in work life.
* We work according to a hybrid remote model. When we are not working from home, we work in SEB: s Tech Office in Solna.


 Ready to take the next step on your career journey?
   

  

 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 7th of January. If you have questions about the position, please contact recruiting manager Mikael Gustafsson by mail mikael.gustafsson1@seb.se.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/techcareers
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Data Engineer
description:
My client is looking for a Data Engineer/Datawarehouse Engineer to help them f
 **ully transform their data environment by building out a completely new cloud data platform within Snowflake** 
 . This is an exciting time to join them and lead this project!
 



  





 The company's main focus is the automotive aftermarket, where they are the partner and distributor of world leading manufacturers of car parts and accessories. Since they've been going for over 70 years and across multiple markets, they're incredibly stable and have a huge amount of data potential at their fingertips; it's all about how they can use modern principals and tools to be become even more data driven and automated.
 



  





 As the Data Engineer you will play a key role in designing, building and improving/maintaining data flows, while working closely with the business to understand how their data can be used to create genuine business value; both internally and for their customers.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* **Design, build and deploy:** 
 Develop data solutions that are linked to vehicle and product data, across multiple business units, inc. sales, supply chain, prod management, etc. This looks like robust and efficient data pipelines, working with ETL from various data sources.
* **Data modelling:** 
 Optimizing data structures for effective data management and analysis, while monitoring system performance by identifying and remedying bottlenecks.
* **Collaboration:** 
 Across tech and operations, working closely with stakeholders and other data and tech people who will support in the build of this new data platform.
* **Keep up to date:** 
 Research into and work with the latest trends and best practices, spearheading any new adoption and conversations across the team.



  





**Qualifications** 



* Minimum of 3 years working as a Data Engineer, Datawarehouse Developer, BI Developer or similar - if you don't have experience with data infrastructure (and setting this up in the cloud) and modelling, you should be interested in it
* Fluency in SQL and ideally Python
* Comfortable working with cloud and most preferably Azure and/or Snowflake - their tech stack includes Snowflake, Data Factory and Power BI
* BSc/MSc in a relevant field
* As a person you should be curious, passionate about data and emerging technologies, with great communication skills and the ability to translate business requirements into tech
* Professional fluency in Swedish is required



  





 In this position, you will get a lot of trust to do your own thing and take on a huge amount of responsibility where you can make a lot of your own solutions and have full control over the Data strategy.
 



  





 Interested in finding out more? Apply with your updated CV.

title: Java Software Engineer (R-17136)
description:
**Why We Work at Dun & Bradstreet**
 Dun & Bradstreet combines global data and local expertise to help clients make smarter decisions. With 6,000+ people in 31 countries, we are a team of diverse thinkers and problem solvers who all share a common curiosity: to find new ways to turn data into value. If you share this curiosity and want to be part of a future-ready company, come join us! Learn more at dnb.com/careers .
   

  

 Are you passionate about backend development and ready to take on a wide-ranging, impactful role? Our Development Unit 4 in Sweden, is looking for a driven developer to join our agile team.
   

  

 The team manages a diverse set of responsibilities, including Solinfra, BRG, AAA Live-logo, RGS-services, D&B Credit Reports, and more. As an active team member, you’ll contribute to coding, testing, and documenting new features while maintaining existing services in a production environment. Collaboration is key—working closely with Product Managers, stakeholders, and other teams, you’ll help move tasks forward in alignment with our Tech Lead and Agile Product Owner’s guidance.
   

  

 If you thrive in an agile, collaborative environment and are eager to make an impact, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Coding, including creating unit and integration tests, and documentation for code and services produced.
* Be an active participant in the team’s agile work process; estimate work tasks, sprint planning, participate in sprint demos etc.
* Align and coordinate delivery with Product Managers, product team colleagues and Tech Lead to ensure consistency in solutions.
* Collaborate with other teams and stakeholders outside of the product team when needed to solve an assigned task.
* Participate in handling of incidents related to team’s services in the production environment.


**Your Profile**
* Experienced backend developer with experience from working in microservices environment with continuous deployment. Extensive experience from working with some of our technical tools including Java, Spring, REST APIs, SOAP, Apache Camel, Kubernetes, Spring Boot. Preferably also with some experience from XSLT, MongoDB, Postgres and Kafka.
* An academic degree in one of the following areas Engineering/Computer science/Information systems.
* Experience from working with Nordic credit data solutions.
* Problem-solver with a positive attitude and experience of managing and working with stakeholders.
* Team player, responsible, structured.
* Good communication (English) and social skills.


**Why Join Us?**
**Benefits**
 Does this role sound like a great opportunity but you’re not sure about making a move? We are really proud of our company and culture and think we have some great things to offer. Some of our benefits in Sweden include:
   

  

* Two paid volunteer days to contribute to causes in your community
* A paid day every year to use for your health and wellness
* Instead of half days before public holidays, you will have 4 additional full days a year for you to use to celebrate what is meaningful to you
* Annual wellness/sport benefit
* Collective agreement, pension, insurance and parental pay allowance
* Access to free services providing support and counselling
* Flexible working arrangements and hybrid work arrangement for most roles


***Whilst some roles do have certain requirements which are essential, we try to focus on hiring based on potential rather than CV as much as possible. If you are unsure you fully meet the requirements, we would still love to hear from you!***
 All Dun & Bradstreet job postings can be found at https://www.dnb.com/about-us/careers-and-people/joblistings.html and https://jobs.lever.co/dnb . Official communication from Dun & Bradstreet will come from an email address ending in @dnb.com.
   

  

 Notice to Applicants : Please be advised that this job posting page is hosted and powered by Lever. Your use of this page is subject to Lever's Privacy Notice and Cookie Policy , which governs the processing of visitor data on this platform.

title: Bli Fullstack-utvecklare hos Lavendla
description:
***Lavendla är ett innovativt företag som förenklar personliga rådgivningstjänster i över 10 000 kundmöten per år. Bli en del av vårt team och bidra till att göra det svåra lättare i Sverige och Danmark.***




  





 Lavendla är ett ledande bolag inom vår nisch med en stark entreprenörsanda och stort fokus på att hela tiden ligga i framkant vad gäller teknik och marknadsföring. Vår vision, att "Göra det svåra lättare," genomsyrar allt vi gör. Sedan starten 2014 har vårt fokus varit att ha det bästa digitala kunderbjudandet inom personliga rådgivningstjänster. Ett fokus som tagit oss från Sverige till Norden och numera även internationellt. Med över 200 frilansande begravningsrådgivare, jurister och terapeuter på vår plattform, sätter vi standarden i över 10 000+ kundmöten per år.
 



  





**DINA ARBETSUPPGIFTER** 




 Som utvecklare på Lavendla spelar du en central roll i att utveckla och koppla vårt egna API med de webbplatser och funktioner som våra kunder möts av, såsom lavendla.se, samt vår egenutvecklade plattform. Du kommer att vara avgörande för att skapa framtidens kundupplevelser, ligga i framkant av teknologin, och nå den grad av automatisering och skalbarhet vi strävar efter. Dina arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:
 



  




* Utveckla och underhålla funktioner på vår plattform som stödjer verksamheten, vilket bidrar till att göra komplexa uppgifter enklare för våra kunder och användare.
* Arbeta med integrationer och API-utveckling för att säkerställa en smidig användarupplevelse.
* Delta i hela utvecklingsprocessen, från planering och design till implementation och testning, vilket ger dig möjlighet att påverka projekt från start till mål.
* Du säkerställer hög kvalitet genom att använda och skriva automatiserade tester, såsom Cypress, Unit och feature-tester, som en integrerad del av ditt arbetsflöde.
* Samarbeta med hela teamet för att förstå behov och ta fram innovativa lösningar, samtidigt som du får chansen att lära av och inspirera dina kollegor.



  





**VEM ÄR DU?** 




 Vi söker en passionerad och erfaren utvecklare som älskar utmaningar och är redo att växa tillsammans med oss. Du är en person som drivs av innovation och är angelägen om att bidra med dina idéer i ett stöttande och dynamiskt team.
 



  




* Mer än 5 års erfarenhet inom produktutveckling, gärna med erfarenhet av att arbeta i snabbrörliga och kreativa miljöer.
* Gedigna kunskaper i moderna PHP- och JavaScript-ramverk som React, Laravel och VueJS, med en stark förståelse för att skapa skalbara lösningar.
* Erfarenhet av att skriva och använda tester, inklusive Cypress, Unit och feature-tester, som en självklar del av ditt arbete.
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla och arbeta med externa API och integrationer (t.ex. AWS, Google, Zapier, Visma.net, Stripe).
* Förmåga att arbeta effektivt i mindre team på 4-5 personer och ta ansvar för projekt från start till mål, med en stark problemlösningsförmåga och en vilja att ständigt lära och utvecklas.
* Intresserad av att utgå från något av våra kontor i Stockholm, Linköping, Norrköping, Oskarshamn eller på distans från en ännu bättre plats som passar dig.



  





**LÄR KÄNNA VÅRT TEAM** 




 Vi är ett engagerat och tekniskt riktigt vasst team som i stora delar arbetar på distans. Våra medarbetare är vår största tillgång och vi är stolta över att ha dedikerade och kreativa kollegor som alla bidrar till vår framgång.
 



  




* **Victor** 
 är vår passionerade webbutvecklare med fokus på frontend och UX-design. Med sin tekniska kunskap och bakgrund i grafisk design från Linköpings universitet skapar han användarvänliga och estetiskt tilltalande digitala upplevelser från sitt kontor i Oskarshamn. Victor började som konsult hos oss 2016 och blev fast anställd 2020. På fritiden går det mesta av Viktors tid och engagemang till familjen och musiken, där han framför allt uppskattar att spela gitarr och låta kreativiteten flöda både i toner och kod.
* **Viktor** 
 , som är bosatt i Norrköping, har en brinnande passion för frontendutveckling med JavaScript och React. Han började som konsult hos oss 2015 och blev fast anställd 2020. Viktor är en problemlösare med en bred kompetens att bygga robust arkitektur och han kombinerar sin medieteknikutbildning från Linköpings universitet med sin passion för film och resor. Viktors Shiba Inu, Aki, är en trogen följeslagare på Norrköpingskontoret.
* **Marco** 
 har sedan 2023 ansvarat för att utveckla och optimera vår backend-struktur. Med en utbildning i webbprogrammering från Linnéuniversitetet och en gedigen erfarenhet som Senior Web Developer hos flera ledande webbyråer, bidrar han med djup teknisk expertis. Han arbetar från ett kontorshotell i Linköping och spenderar sin fritid med musik, löpning och TV-serier. Marco värdesätter friheten och den stöttande arbetsmiljön hos Lavendla.
* **Martin** 
 är teamets nykomling som började på Lavendla 2024 och har med sig flerårig erfarenhet som Fullstack-utvecklare från att ha jobbat på webbyrå tidigare. På fritiden är Martin mycket engagerad i sport och agerar även fotbollstränare om kvällar och helger.
* **Charlie** 
 är teamets Head of Growth, en exil-göteborgare med en stark passion för digital marknadsföring och innovation. Sedan 2021 har han arbetat från Stockholm och varit ansvarig för tillväxt och innovation. Charlie älskar att resa och upptäcka nya platser med sin drönare och dykutrustning. Han lyfter fram teamets driv och mod att ständigt höja ribban som det bästa med Lavendla.
* **Jakob** 
 , grundare och VD, älskar att dansa och är riktigt vass när det kommer till bugg och salsa. Jakob leder företaget med passion och tror starkt på vårt fantastiska team som kärnan till Lavendlas framgång.



  





 Vi är stolta över att vara en del av ett företag som inte bara förändrar branschen, utan även ödmjuka inför att det vi gör skapar meningsfulla karriärer för våra rådgivare och förbättrar livet för de slutkunder som vi hjälper.
 



  





 Som anställd hos oss blir du en del av ett starkt och sammansvetsat team där vi värdesätter högt i tak och ditt personliga engagemang i att utveckla produkten.
 



  





 Vi är nyfikna och gillar att testa oss fram samtidigt som vi inte är rädda för att misslyckas. Misstag är en del av vår lärandeprocess och leder till framgångsrika lösningar.
 



  





**ANSÖKAN** 




 Skicka in din ansökan och bli en del av vårt team på Lavendla. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
 



  





 Vi undanbeder kontakt från rekryteringsföretag.

title: Data Engineer - Business intelligence developer to Scania
description:
Do you love working with loads of interesting data? Do you have a passion for data modelling? Are you excited to apply your technical skills to analyse data, and help Scania get new valuable insights from it? Then we would like to welcome you as a Data Engineer to our team at Scania!
   

  

*Scania is currently undergoing an exciting transformation from a traditional truck manufacturer to a provider of complete sustainable transport solutions. IT is a crucial part of this transformation as Scania’s success is depending on flexible and efficient IT solutions that support current and future business requirements. Be a part of this journey as a BI developer.*
*Our department plays a large role in Scania’s data strategy to deliver state of the art analytical solutions. We enable and enhance data to empower our employees to perform at their best by providing excellent solutions that increase and secure the right decisions to reach and exceed the business goals.*
**YOU WILL**
 Be a part of a Squad consisting of BI developers and a Service Delivery Manager working with different organizations in Scania. You will be part of a very open and welcoming team’ that has a passion for working with BI solutions, and together you will create BI reports that bring value to our customers. You will have the possibility to work at least 3 days remotely per week.
   

  

 We work closely with business (Business & IT as One) and with various stakeholder groups to gather and document reporting requirements to meet business needs. We use scrum methodologies and sprints to follow up our work. Together with the squad, you will be developing high quality BI solutions including new projects as well as enhancing our existing portfolio with new requirements and performance adjustments. Our technical platforms are in both cloud and on prem. The cloud setup is AWS based with Snowflake as a data warehouse, Matillion as our ETL/ELT tool and PowerBI as a visualization tool. Our legacy on prem platform with the Scania common data warehouse is Oracle based and SQL server on prem with Power BI as visualization tool. We are in a very exciting transition phase to move away from on prem into our highly capable cloud platform with hundreds of data sources and hundreds of reporting applications.
   

  

**IN ORDER TO SUCCEED IN THE ROLE, WE SEE THAT YOU HAVE**
* 4+years in PowerBI development (on Cloud + Report server) with good knowledge of working with Cloud Technologies (Snowflake) and support.
* 4+years’ experience in Developing Solutions for Data Analytics such as building semantic models.
* Strong DAX programming knowledge.
* Working experience with both low code and high code environments for ETL such as Matillion, ODI, DBT
* Deep knowledge about dimensional modelling, data access and data storage
* Advanced SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases
* Experience of Tabular Editor and other BI/DW tools.
* Basic understanding on git branching, Push and Pull code to and from git repository
* Strong English language skills
* Involved in requirement gathering for reporting application and worked with customer
* BSc or MSc in Computer Science or related field (or equivalent experience)


**WE SEE IT AS A BIG PLUS IF YOU HAVE ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING:**
* You have experience from working with Logistics or Production or other relevant business area
* Experience and enjoyment of agile (JIRA) methods and DevOps to deliver value continuously
* Snowflake/AWS Services experience
* Technical lead experience meriting


**Who Are You**
 You add energy to the group and push the team to reach new levels. You take responsibility for your own and the team's development and are excited to drive improvements, within both processes and tools. You are a team player person who dares to take initiative and can easily adjust to different situations and working conditions. You are communicating fluently in English and have the ability to connect with users and their representatives, being able to understand requirements and analyse data. Meet users' expectations and bring clarity to unclear requirements through dialogue. In addition, a person who enjoys having fun with colleagues is much appreciated!
   

  

**WE OFFER**
 We offer an exciting work environment where you develop and maintain the skills needed to meet future challenges, flexible working hours, great team spirit, working in a global organization. If you live in Stockholm we offer direct buss between Stockholm and Södertälje.
   

  

 If the above sounds like you, don’t hesitate to apply. We are interviewing continuously
   

  

 A background check might be conducted for this position.
   

  

**FOR MORE INFORMATION**
 Please contact recruiting manager: Subhash Ghimire, e-mail: subhashchandra.ghimire@scania.com
   

  

 To apply, please use the provided link. We kindly request that applications not be submitted via email. Please note that from July 1st to August 9th, we will be unable to respond to inquiries. Thank you for your understanding.
   

  

 Scania is a world-leading provider of transport solutions. Together with our partners and customers we are driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. In 2022, we delivered 80,238 trucks, 4,994 buses as well as 13,400 industrial and marine power systems to our customers. Net sales totalled to over SEK 170 billion, of which 21 percent were services related. Founded in 1891, Scania now operates in more than 100 countries and employs some 57,000 people. Research and development are mainly concentrated in Sweden. Production takes place in Europe and Latin America with regional product centres in Africa, Asia and Eurasia. Scania is part of TRATON GROUP. For more information visit: www.scania.com

title: Technical Account Manager (Sweden)
description:
***This job is with Amazon, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.***
**Description**
 At Amazon, our vision is to be earth's most customer-centric company. In 2006, we launched Amazon Web Services, giving customers access to the same cloud technology we built to serve millions of shoppers on Amazon.com. Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a secure cloud services platform, offering computing power, database storage, content delivery, and other functionality to help businesses scale and grow. Millions of businesses are using AWS cloud solutions to build sophisticated applications with increased flexibility, scalability and reliability.
   

  

**About AWS**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn't followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don't let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating - that's why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it's in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We're continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth's Best Employer. That's why you'll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there's nothing we can't achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 The Role
   

  

 An AWS Technical Account Manager is a trusted advisor and cloud operations architect for our Enterprise Support customers. As a trusted advisor you'll have a direct impact in helping our customers gain the most value from cloud technology. You'll craft and execute strategies to drive our customers' adoption and use of AWS services. This includes a range of products including EC2, S3, DynamoDB & RDS databases, Lambda, CloudFront CDN, IoT and many more.
   

  

 Our Technical Account Managers partner with some of the most iconic businesses in the country. These range from rising startups building their business from scratch through to large enterprises going through significant transformation. You'll provide advice on architecture, support strategy, project and launch planning as well as ongoing operational issues.
   

  

**See What The Team Say About Their Roles**
 https://emea-resources.awscloud.com/write-your-own-story/meet-liga-sr-technical-account-manager
   

  

 https://emea-resources.awscloud.com/write-your-own-story/meet-balint-senior-technical-account-manager
   

  

 https://emea-resources.awscloud.com/write-your-own-story/meet-shlomo-senior-technical-account-manager
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* You'll advise on solutions, provide technical guidance and advocate for the customer
* Ensure AWS environments remain operationally healthy whilst reducing cost and complexity
* Develop trusting relationships with customers, understanding their business needs and technical challenges
* Using your technical acumen and customer obsession, you'll drive technical discussions regarding incidents, trade-offs, and risk management
* Consult with a range of partners from developers through to C-suite executives
* Collaborate with AWS Solutions Architects, Business Developers, Professional Services Consultants, and Sales Account Managers
* With a bias for action, you'll proactively find opportunities for customers to gain additional value from AWS
* Provide detailed reviews of service events, monthly & quarterly metrics, detailed pre-launch planning
* Solve a variety of problems across different customers as they migrate their workloads to the cloud
* Uplift customer capabilities by running workshops, brown bag sessions, etc.


 A day in the life
   

  

 "AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services."
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn't followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don't let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating - that's why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there's nothing we can't achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it's in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We're continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth's Best Employer. That's why you'll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience in a similar role as a Technical Account Manager, Consultant, Solutions Architect, Platform Engineer, Systems Engineer, Cloud Architect etc.
* Understand operational parameters and troubleshooting for a combination of the following: Compute, Storage, Networking, CDN, Databases, DevOps, Big Data and Analytics, Security, Applications Development
* Internal enterprise or external customer-facing experience with the ability to clearly articulate to small and large audiences
* Ability to juggle tasks and projects in a fast-paced environment
* Customer obsessed


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Professional experience with cloud offerings such as AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform etc.
* Programming or scripting skills with a combination of Java, Python Perl, Ruby, C#, and/or PHP a plus but not a requirement
* Previous experience as a Software Engineer, Developer, DevOps Engineer etc.
* Understanding of DevOps practices and tools including Continuous Integration / Deployment, Puppet, Docker, Kubernetes, Chef is a plus


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you're applying in isn't listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

 At Amazon, our vision is to be earth’s most customer-centric company. In 2006, we launched Amazon Web Services, giving customers access to the same cloud technology we built to serve millions of shoppers on Amazon.com. Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a secure cloud services platform, offering computing power, database storage, content delivery, and other functionality to help businesses scale and grow. **About AWS**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply.  Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 The Role
   

  

 An AWS Technical Account Manager is a trusted advisor and cloud operations architect for our Enterprise Support customers. As a trusted advisor you’ll have a direct impact in helping our customers gain the most value from cloud technology. You’ll craft and execute strategies to drive our customers’ adoption and use of AWS services. This includes a range of products including EC2, S3, DynamoDB & RDS databases, Lambda, CloudFront CDN, IoT and many more.
   

  

 Our Technical Account Managers partner with some of the most iconic businesses in the country. These range from rising startups building their business from scratch through to large enterprises going through significant transformation. You’ll provide advice on architecture, support strategy, project and launch planning as well as ongoing operational issues.
   

  

**See What The Team Say About Their Roles**
 https://emea-resources.awscloud.com/write-your-own-story/meet-liga-sr-technical-account-manager
   

  

 https://emea-resources.awscloud.com/write-your-own-story/meet-balint-senior-technical-account-manager
   

  

 https://emea-resources.awscloud.com/write-your-own-story/meet-shlomo-senior-technical-account-manager
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* You’ll advise on solutions, provide technical guidance and advocate for the customer
* Ensure AWS environments remain operationally healthy whilst reducing cost and complexity
* Develop trusting relationships with customers, understanding their business needs and technical challenges
* Using your technical acumen and customer obsession, you’ll drive technical discussions regarding incidents, trade-offs, and risk management
* Consult with a range of partners from developers through to C-suite executives
* Collaborate with AWS Solutions Architects, Business Developers, Professional Services Consultants, and Sales Account Managers
* With a bias for action, you'll proactively find opportunities for customers to gain additional value from AWS
* Provide detailed reviews of service events, monthly & quarterly metrics, detailed pre-launch planning
* Solve a variety of problems across different customers as they migrate their workloads to the cloud
* Uplift customer capabilities by running workshops, brown bag sessions, etc.


 A day in the life
   

  

 “AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.”
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience in a similar role as a Technical Account Manager, Consultant, Solutions Architect, Platform Engineer, Systems Engineer, Cloud Architect etc.
* Understand operational parameters and troubleshooting for a combination of the following: Compute, Storage, Networking, CDN, Databases, DevOps, Big Data and Analytics, Security, Applications Development
* Internal enterprise or external customer-facing experience with the ability to clearly articulate to small and large audiences
* Ability to juggle tasks and projects in a fast-paced environment
* Customer obsessed


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Professional experience with cloud offerings such as AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform etc.
* Programming or scripting skills with a combination of Java, Python Perl, Ruby, C#, and/or PHP a plus but not a requirement
* Previous experience as a Software Engineer, Developer, DevOps Engineer etc.
* Understanding of DevOps practices and tools including Continuous Integration / Deployment, Puppet, Docker, Kubernetes, Chef is a plus


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: Technical Project Manager-Smart Store Technology Enhancement
Senior Backend Developer till IT Martech
description:
*Vill du ta nästa steg och bli en del av vårt nya team IT Martech? Vi söker nu en senior backend-utvecklare som vill utveckla och utvecklas inom området Martech. Vill du arbeta med utveckling på ett bolag med den senaste tekniken och i ett team där vi har kul på jobbet? Då är detta rollen för dig!* 




  





**I rollen får du:** 




 - Arbeta med utveckling och förvaltning av marknads tekniska system, backend-applikationer och dataintegrationer.
 



 - Ansvara för och optimera den övergripande systemarkitekturen.
 



 - Vara med från starten i vårt nya team IT Martech och kommer kunna påverka teamets way of working.
 



 - Vara delaktig i att kontinuerligt förbättra teamets utvecklings- och kvalitetsprocesser.
 



 - Stödja affären i att uppnå visionen av ett effektivt och datadrivet arbetssätt för att skapa en sömlös kundupplevelse.
 



  





 Martech är all teknologi som används för att optimera marknadsföringsinsatser, inklusive alla verktyg och processer som hjälper marknadsförare att planera, genomföra, mäta och inte minst optimera kampanjer och aktiviteter för att skapa kundvärde och unika och personliga kundupplevelser. Som senior backend developer i vårt team IT Martech kommer du att arbeta med utveckling och förvaltning av marknads tekniska system och backend-integrationer för dataflöden till och från vårt marketing automation system Adobe Campaign – både för att säkerställa att kampanjteamet kan agera på korrekt data och följa gällande lagkrav samt främja ett hållbart spelande hos våra kunder.
 



  





 Rollen innebär även utveckling av nya microtjänster för kundkommuikation samt robusta integrationer till bland annat en molnbaserad dataplattform. För rätt person kan rollen dessutom innehålla uppgifter som tech lead som i samarbete med IT-arkitekterna ansvarar för marknads övergripande systemarkitektur. Du kommer att samarbeta tätt med andra delar av ATG för att bidra till produktutvecklingen och en datadriven kundupplevelse i världsklass.
 



  





**Är det här du?** 




 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper och för att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du som söker har högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande inom systemutveckling samt har förståelse för det agila arbetssättet. Du har även några års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet inom backend-utveckling och ett genuint intresse för den tekniska marknadsföringen och hur man skapar kundvärde genom relevant kommunikation i alla kanaler. Vi ser att du är nyfiken, orädd och ambitiös. Då det är ett relativt nytt team ser vi att du är prestigelös och gillar att dela med dig av din kunskap. Vidare söker vi dig med en god kommunikativ förmåga på både engelska och svenska, eftersom en stor del av arbetet kan ske på engelska. Det är meriterande med erfarenhet inom Machine Learning och AI.
 



  





 Vi ser att du har några års erfarenhet av:
 



 - Kotlin/Java/Spring Boot
 



 - Python
 



 - AWS
 



 - Openshift/Kubernetes
 



 - REST, SOAP
 



 - Robusta dataintegrationer med höga krav på tillförlitlighet, test och kvalitet.
 



  





**” Tillsammans kan vi flytta berg”** 




 Tillsammans kan vi flytta berg - det finns nästan inget som inspirerar mig mer än starka team där individer får ta plats, blir sedda och kan utvecklas och därmed bidra till något alldeles fantastiskt. Jag bygger mitt ledarskap på transparens och kommunikation, vilket är A och O i att skapa engagemang, motivation och tillit och de rätta förutsättningarna för gruppen. På min lediga tid älskar jag att vara ute i naturen tillsammans med min familj och vänner - i löpspåret, skidbacken eller på golfbanan. Just ATGs fokus på hälsa är enastående och vårt hållbarhetsarbete gällande medarbetarna, våra kunder och hästnäringen, tillsammans med en väldigt inkluderande företagskultur gör att det är roligt att gå till jobbet varje dag.”
 



**- Rekryterande chef, Solvejg Berntzon, Manager IT Martech** 




  





**We are the game** 




 I mer än 50 år har vi på ATG levererat spänning och underhållning till svenska folket. Vi drivs av att trygga den svenska hästnäringen och att fortsatt vara ett ansvarsfullt spelbolag i framkant. Vår vision att leverera världens bästa spelupplevelse. Hos oss är du en del av en innovativ miljö – med hjälp av den senaste tekniken utvecklar vi spelupplevelser i världsklass. Självledarskap och kompetensutveckling är viktiga delar för oss. Sedan starten 1974 har vi byggt och förvaltat systemen för våra produkter som hanterar 4 500 000 transaktioner per dag.
 



  





**Join the game!** 




 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan via vår rekryteringsportal antingen med ditt cv eller din LinkedIn-profil – det som är enklast och smidigast för dig. Läs gärna mer om oss på vår karriärsida och tveka inte att höra av dig om du har frågor om tjänsten.
 



  





 Vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning och kommer att göra en bakgrundskontroll för denna roll. Tjänsten är på heltid och utgår från vårt kontor vid Solvalla, alldeles intill travbanan. Vi har ett flexibelt arbetssätt vilket innebär att du har möjlighet att kombinera distansarbete med arbete från kontoret. Var med och bygg världens bästa spelupplevelse tillsammans med oss!

title: Lead AI Developer - Python Automation
description:
*Are you passionate about developing innovative AI and automation solutions?* 




  





 Zimply are on a mission to unlock value through cutting-edge technology and automation. That’s why they have developed AI assistants designed to tackle repetitive tasks across a wide range of industries. By automating these time-consuming activities, Zimply empowers people to focus on what truly matters.
 



  





 We are now looking for a Lead AI Developer to join in creating the AI and automation solutions of the future. If you have a passion for automation and AI, and solid experience with Python, we want to hear from you!
 



  





**About the Role** 




 As the Lead AI Developer, you will become a key player in the mission to streamline and automate processes using innovative technologies. You’ll be part of leading the design and development of architecture for AI solutions, with a particular focus on Python, Automation, prompt engineering and LLM (Large Language Model) development.
 



  





**You will:** 



* Work in close collaboration with the CTO to design robust and scalable architecture for AI solutions.
* Guide the team and lead the implementation and development of automation solutions in Python.
* Work with and implement tools / frameworks like Playwright, Selenium, Robocorp, Cypress, or similar to create smooth automation workflows.
* Collaborate closely with the team to ensure high quality and operational reliability in the solutions, both technically and functionally.



  





**About you** 




 We believe you are a structured and focused person who naturally takes initiative. You have great organizational and problem-solving skills, and thrive in an entrepreneurial, fast-paced environment. You enjoy working in a close-knit team towards shared goals and want to grow together with your colleagues and the company.
 



  





**To thrive and succeed in this role, we believe you have:** 



* At least 5 years of experience in Python development
* Solid experience working with automation in Python and tools like Playwright, Selenium, Robocorp, or Cypress
* Deep understanding of architectural issues and experience with solution architecture
* Experience developing and working with LLMs (Large Language Models) and prompt engineering
* Fluent English, both spoken and written



  





 I
 **t’s a plus if you have** 



* Experience in fine-tuning LLMs
* Knowledge in Machine Learning and its applications
* Cloud experience, e.g., Azure, GCP, or AWS
* Experience working with Python orchestration tools
* Experience in Intelligent Automation, such as RPA (Robotic Process Automation), computer vision, and IDP (Intelligent Document Processing)
* Fluent in Swedish, both spoken and written



  





**Why Zimply?** 




 At Zimply you’ll have the opportunity to work with exciting technology and be part of an innovative team driven by a passion for automation and AI. You will join a dynamic work environment where you can grow alongside the company and dedicated colleagues, working together to create solutions that drive meaningful impact.
 



  





**We offer you:** 



* Competitive salary
* Wellness allowance of SEK 5,000 per year
* Pension and Private Health insurance
* Flexible working hours
* Possibility to be eligible for stock options
* Offices in central Stockholm or Gothenburg



  





 Are you ready to take the next step in your career and make a difference? Apply today and become a part of our team!
 



  





**Zimply is working together with Safemind as a recruitment partner managing this recruitment process.**

title: Function developer for advanced driver assistance systems
description:
**Role Summary**
 Do you want to be part of developing advanced functions that save lives? Would you like to be involved in developing, for example, advanced emergency braking, warning functions for pedestrians and cyclists, advanced cruise control, fatigue indicator, and sign recognition?
   

  

 Our section, Main Systems, is responsible for Scania's most central control system with com-pletely in-house developed functions and software. We work agile in cross-functional teams with co-located expertise with great influence on our working methods and content.
   

  

**Your role**
 We are looking for a new team member to join the Driver Assistance Functions group who wants to be involved in developing ADAS (Advanced Driver Assistance Systems) functions. We develop features that save lives and help the driver to drive safely with high comfort and energy efficiency. With a fusion of information from maps and external sensors such as cam-eras and radars, we create functions that warn or act actively to manage hazards and protect vulnerable road users.
   

  

 We are in the middle of an exciting part of the development of several new features and we hope you want to join us and take on the challenges we have ahead of us.
   

  

**Your work tasks**
 In the role of Function Developer, you will have cross-functional contacts, with different parts of the company. You'll be able to be involved in everything from the first brush strokes of new features to making our existing functions even better. The work is done in close col-laboration with your very talented colleagues in our group.
   

  

 The tasks are varied and the group is responsible for the entire delivery, from understanding what the customer wants and how new legal requirements affect us, all the way to deliver functions to production and a satisfied end customer.
   

  

 As part of a typical working day, you will develop functions and conduct tests in different test environments. We write requirements, systemize, implement with Matlab Simulink, and write test cases in Python.
   

  

 Of course, we are out in our vehicles and test on the road and test track, collecting and ana-lyzes measurement data to adjust the function. We are also responsible for ensuring that the functions pass certifications.
   

  

**Your background**
 You probably have a Master degree or equivalent experience. You are a driven and commu-nicative person who is interested in developing further in your role. We also see that you are responsible, have good collaboration skills, and have an interest in working with agile meth-ods. You are positive about practical elements in your workday, such as handling logging equipment or going out to test in vehicles. You continuously actively participate in our quest to constantly become better and better. Fluent English and ambitions to learn Swedish is a requirement. Experience in system engineering, system development, function develop-ment, control systems, testing, or agile methods is highly commendable.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 As an employee at Scania, in addition to career and development opportunities, we offer other benefits such as performance bonuses, occupational pensions, company cars, flexible working hours, lunch at a reduced price, and much more. If you live in Stockholm, we offer direct bus service between Stockholm and Södertälje with Scania Jobexpress.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV, personal letter, and grade copies. Please apply as soon as possible but no later than 2025-01-07. Ongoing selection and interviews will take place during the application period, the position may be filled before the end of the application period.
   

  

 We use logic and personality tests in our selection process and a background check may be conducted for this position.
   

  

**Further information**
 Anders Sundström, head of driver assistance functions, anders.x.sundstrom@scania.com

title: Frontend Developer Angular till IT Horse Core
description:
*Vill du ta nästa steg och bli en del av vårt team IT Horse Core? Vi söker nu en frontend-utvecklare som vill utveckla och utvecklas inom ATG!* 




  





**I rollen får du:** 




 - Bidra med din erfarenhet och förmågor för att bygga framtidens lösning tillsammans med skickliga och engagerade kollegor.
 



 - Skapa schyssta spelupplevelser för våra kunder.
 



 - Styra över din arbetstid och ha balans i livet.
 



  





 Vill du vara med och utveckla användargränssnittet för vår nästa generations spelsystem? IT Core Betting/Horse Core-teamet skapar innovativa lösningar och samarbetar nära med team som utvecklar spelsystem, hanterar spelobjekt för hästsport och fotboll, och deltar i spännande projekt med flera intressenter. UI-teamet inom grupperingen ansvarar för att utveckla gränssnittet mot vårt centrala hästspelsystem samt vår egen portallösning. Portalen är en modulär plattform som inte bara erbjuder ett eget gränssnitt utan också integrerar andra teams gränssnitts-widgetar, vilket skapar en optimerad och sammanhängande användarupplevelse.
 



  





 För att lyckas i den här rollen ser vi att du har flera års erfarenhet av frontendutveckling i Angular. Du har en stark analytisk förmåga för att tolka krav och önskemål och trivs med att samarbeta nära produktägare och andra beställare. Du är van vid agil utveckling och uppskattar ett explorativt och utredande arbetssätt. Din goda arkitektoniska förmåga hjälper dig att skapa hållbara och skalbara lösningar.
 



  





 Har du dessutom ett intresse för UX-design? Det är en stor bonus! Teamet arbetar självständigt och använder våra UX-designers som kreativa bollplank. IT Horse Core är ett litet, sammansvetsat team där samarbete och självledarskap värderas högt.
 



  





**Är det här du?** 




 Vi söker dig som brinner för utveckling och har en högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande inom systemutveckling. Du har några års relevant erfarenhet och en god förståelse för det agila arbetssättet. Som person är du nyfiken, orädd och ambitiös, samtidigt som du är prestigelös och gärna delar med dig av din kunskap.
 



  





 Då en stor del av arbetet kan ske på engelska behöver du vara kommunikativ på både svenska och engelska. I den här rollen jobbar du till största delen på distans och kan bo var som helst i Sverige. Tidigare erfarenhet från företag med högintensiva transaktioner är meriterande.
 



  





 Vi ser att du har några års erfarenhet av:
 


* Angular
* SASS
* Typescript
* NodeJS
* API
* Material UI
* Jest / Playwright / Cypress
* Express Framework
* Docker
* CI/CD



  





 Meriterande:
 


* Tailwindcss
* Containers
* AWS
* Microfrontend



  





**”Jag ger utrymme för alla att växa som individer men även som team ”** 




 Mitt huvudsakliga mål som manager är att inte behövas i teamens dagliga arbete. Jag vill hjälpa mina team att få verktyg, de processer, och den arbetsmiljö de behöver för att fortsätta leverera vad ATG behöver, medan jag ger utrymme för alla att växa som individer men även som team tillsammans. Jag har jobbat på ATG sedan juni 2001, först som utvecklare och projektledare, och sedan våren 2017 som manager för Horse Core teamen.
 



**- Rekryterande chef, Ulrika Gullo, Manager IT Horse Core** 




  





**We are the game** 




 I närmare 50 år har vi på ATG levererat spänning och underhållning till svenska folket. Vi drivs av att trygga den svenska hästnäringen och att fortsatt vara ett ansvarsfullt spelbolag i framkant. Vår vision att leverera världens bästa spelupplevelse. Hos oss är du en del av en innovativ miljö – med hjälp av den senaste tekniken utvecklar vi spelupplevelser i världsklass. Självledarskap och kompetensutveckling är viktiga delar för oss. Sedan starten 1974 har vi byggt och förvaltat systemen för våra produkter som hanterar 4 500 000 transaktioner per dag.
 



  





**Join the game!** 




 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan via vår rekryteringsportal antingen med ditt cv eller din LinkedIn-profil – det som är enklast och smidigast för dig. Läs gärna mer om oss på vår karriärsida och tveka inte att höra av dig om du har frågor om tjänsten.
 



  





 Vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning och gör bakgrundskontroller för alla roller. Tjänsten är på heltid och utgår från vårt kontor vid Solvalla, alldeles intill travbanan. Vi har ett flexibelt arbetssätt vilket innebär att du, beroende på roll, har möjlighet att kombinera distansarbete med arbete från kontoret. Var med och bygg världens bästa spelupplevelse tillsammans med oss!

title: Backend Developer till IT Horse Core
description:
*Vill ta chansen att jobba i en dynamisk och lärorik miljö där du är med och bidrar till spelupplevelser i världsklass? Vi söker nu två erfarna och drivna backend-utvecklare till IT Horse Core.* 




  





**I rollen får du:** 




 • Aktivt delta i en teknikförflyttning mot skalbar lösning i molnet.
 



 • Delta i teamets agila ritualer.
 



 • Vara delaktig i att kontinuerligt förbättra teamets utvecklings- och kvalitetsprocesser.
 



  





 Vi söker nu två backend-utvecklare som vill arbeta med utveckling i Kotlin. Här kommer du att ingå i ett av våra team under Core Betting/Horse Core som arbetar med ATG:s centrala spelsystem och dess närmaste tjänster. Tjänsten kan i perioder innebära aktivt deltagande i våra systerteams teknikförflyttning mot skalbar lösning i molnet. Vidare får du delta i teamets agila ritualer samt medverka till ständig förbättring av teamets utvecklings-, kvalitets- och lärandeprocesser. Du kommer att ingå i ett team med andra utvecklare, Scrum Master och produktägare. Känns detta lockande för dig kommer du att välkomnas till ett team som har kul tillsammans och som tror på öppenhet och transparens i arbetet.
 



  





**Är det här du?** 




 Vi söker dig som är en erfaren systemutvecklare med god analytisk förmåga. Du är en lagspelare som ser kompetensdelning som en självklar väg till lärande för dig och andra. Du förstår vikten av att aktivt bidra till kontinuerliga förbättringar i kod och arbetssätt och att hålla din egen kompetens och förmågor aktuella. Du har god kommunikativ förmåga och uttrycker dig obehindrat på svenska och engelska. Vi ser gärna att du har en relevant högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom eller motsvarande kompetens och några års erfarenhet av:

 • Spring
 



 • Enhetstestning/JUnit
 



 • Cloud/Openshift
 



  





 Meriterande:
 



 • Hibernate
 



 • SQL
 



 • Messaging/JMS
 



 • Hazelcast
 



 • Flyway
 



 • Jackson
 



 • Git/GitHub
 



 • Splunk
